description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

In this role, you'll shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and inform future marketing strategies.

As a member of the Consumer Apps Marketing team, you'll develop partnerships, programs, and outreach strategies designed for growing apps with film and television partners. Using key features of our products, you’ll develop programs and partnerships around key uses of our apps that scale globally. You'll align our strategy with the right content opportunities, cross-functional planning, negotiations and ongoing communications with partners.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of brand marketing and marketing partnerships experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of integrated marketing experience.
  • Experience developing high-impact co-marketing programs and prioritizing partnership opportunities. Experience building strategic marketing programs and track record of fostering partner relationships.
  • Understanding of the entertainment industry and social media.
  • Established relationships within the industry.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively influence cross-functionally and communicate with executive management and external partners.
responsibilities:
• Connect G Suite with the entertainment industry through innovative partnerships.
  • Develop long-term relationships with studios and create measurement plans to evaluate partnership success.
  • Work with product and engineering teams to deliver product feedback and develop new features to address partners' usage of our apps products.
  • Develop best practices and collateral focused on the entertainment industry. Scale collateral to global teams at Google.
  • Work on business agreements with Legal to secure movie, music, and licensing agreements for creative deliverables.
title: Partnerships Manager, Consumer Apps
